result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa C Bair

defendant.name: Bair, Melissa C

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Melissa C Bair not in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared in court for Melissa C Bair.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Return on Warrant. Defendant failing to appear, Court takes no further action as case remains in active warrant status.
Email correspondence with parties. Case scheduled for Return on Warrant on 10/20/2022 at 01:45 pm, Br 16.

Defendant Melissa C Bair not in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Melissa C Bair.  Attorney Annie Louk appeared in court on behalf of Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Melissa C Bair appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Melissa C Bair.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Melissa C Bair in court with  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. Defendant Melissa C Bair in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/31/22 @ 1p
